title: Question about installing one version with Admin rights, then a second version without Admin rights (Windows)
content:
I have an installation of the Firefox Release channel (v54, 32bit) that was done using Admin rights (Windows), so I can run it from any user and I must open it with Admin rights in order to allow an update.

On another machine, I also had the Release channel, 32 bit installed, but I'm not sure if that was done with or without Admin rights. On this second machine, I recently installed the Beta channel, 64bit, without Admin rights, and I can now launch either version, but they both seem to share the same profile (and even launching one version, then the other, simply opens a new window in the one that was launched first).

My question is, on my first machine, where Release channel 32bit was installed with Admin rights, if I were to try to install a new version of a different channel (e.g. Beta or Nightly) without Admin rights, what should I expect? I certainly don't want to screw up my profile (since I have a shit-ton of open tabs in my session).

Also, is there any way to tell whether Firefox (or any program) was installed with or without Admin rights (in the case of my 2nd machine), other than to try to update with my regular user account and see if it asks for Admin rights (via the UAC window)? My understanding is that some programs, like Chrome and Evernote, can install without Admin rights, and the program files are stored in the C:\Users\username\Appdata folder, but Firefox seems to have data stored there regardless.
creator: yaktiswan02

title: perdita dei preferiti a seguito reinstallazione windows 11
content: Buongiorno, a causa di un blocco del mio sistema operativo sono stato costretto a reinstallare windows 11. Successivamente ho reinstallato Firefox ma non ho più trovato i miei segnalibri nè ho trovato vecchi profili da cui poterli recuperare. è possibile risolvere l'inconveniente ? Faccio presente di non avere mai effettuato un salvataggio dei segnalibri. Grazie anticipatamente per l'aiuto che mi fornirete Dario
creator: dario.zanotti1

title: Firefox Reverts to Default Settings After Update
content:
Why does Firefox revert to default settings after some updates? It happens randomly, so I never know when I will suddenly lose all of my settings.

It happened again tonight on my Windows 10 laptop. I started my laptop and opened Firefox. It had done an update and displayed a screen saying "Welcome to Firefox." I lost my default home page and all of my user settings. Everything was the factory default. I have used Firefox for many years. This problem is happening more and more often.
creator: skyguywi

title: Speaker issues
content: Hi, I cant seem to hear anything on Firefox. I found out that firefox is not allowing any website to use my speaker. but I cant seem to find any sollution
creator: ganesen9908

title: Firefox cannot detect plugins when running in a container.
content: I am trying to install Adobe Flash player in Firefox 84.0 (the last version support Flash player) when running in a docker container (Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS). I had tried to run Firefox in my real machine (Linux 6.1.0-17-amd64 Debian 12) and it worked well. I just copy the file "libflashplayer.so" to the path "~/.mozilla/plugins". But when Firefox is running in a container, I do the same but it can't found Flash player plugin. No matter where I place the libflashplayer.so, like "~/.mozilla/plugins" or "/usr/lib/firefox/firefox", it don't work, I can't find Flash player in "about:plugins" or "about:addons". I start Firefox from a terminal and there is no error log. I have no idea why it can detect flash player plugin while running in a real system but don't work when running in a container. Thanks.
creator: GoodNameNamedByDog

title: Cannot Open my Gmails accounts.

title: High CPU usage when using Firefox due to SPPSVC of Windows 11
content: Not sure which is the cause. On multiple laptops and desktops after last Windows 11 update and then an immediate Firefox update, the software protection service of Windows 11 goes into high cpu mode consuming 40-50% of cpu when Firefox is opened. Running Firefox version 122.0 (64-bit) version. Tried in safe mode and still having issue. Just an FYI for developers to look into for next Firefox update.
creator: alp35035
